common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure after version 11.1.1 update
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after updating to version 11.1.1 on both macOS and Windows. The issue stemmed from a new vector library requiring AVX2 processor support. The Pieces team acknowledged the issue, requested user logs, and released a patch within 48 hours to address the problem and restore functionality for affected users.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: PiecesOS Launch Issue
**Key Points Raised:**
* User reported an issue where PiecesOS wasn't launching on their macOS system.
* User provided a detailed trace of the issue.

**Problems Identified:**
* New vector library in PiecesOS was causing AVX2 issues on some systems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and actively worked on a fix.
* They identified the CPU version as the potential culprit and asked for more system information.
* User provided CPU information (Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU @ 2.50GHz).
* Team mentioned a potential release with a fix the next day.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* No further information was provided, so the exact outcome is unclear.
*  However, based on the conversation, it can be assumed that the fix was released and the user's issue might be resolved. 

**Additional Notes:**
* The conversation mentions the PiecesOS team actively working on solving similar issues in other reported cases.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User (@GetReal444) is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces application.
* The issue seems related to an error in the CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension due to a lack of AVX2 support on the user's processor.
* This issue might be affecting more users than initially expected.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces is requiring an AVX2-supported processor, excluding users with older hardware.
* This requirement is causing the application to fail to boot on affected machines.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team is working on a solution to address the AVX2 dependency issue.
* A patch is expected to be released within 24-48 hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is currently being addressed by the Pieces team. 
* A fix is expected to be released by the end of the day on February 13th, 2025.

**Additional details:**

* This issue is also related to issues reported in #624 and #625.
* The Pieces team is actively working on a resolution around the clock. 

**Next steps:**

* The user should wait for the patch to be released and then update their application.
* If the issue persists after the update, they can reach out to the Pieces support team for further assistance.

## GitHub Issue Summary
**Title:** Pieces Desktop App Won't Launch (11.1.1)
**Author:** DevWizard24
**Date:** February 11, 2025

### Key Points:
* Users reported issues launching the Pieces Desktop App after updating to version 11.1.1.
* The issue was related to stricter hardware requirements in the new version.
* The issue was identified as affecting multiple users.

### Problems:
* Users were unable to launch the Pieces Desktop App.
* The new version of the app had stricter hardware requirements than previously communicated.

### Solutions:
* The Pieces team requested users to provide logs from their computer.
* A patch was planned for release within 24-48 hours to resolve the issue.
* A mitigation release was scheduled for the following day.

### Outcome:
* The issue was acknowledged and addressed by the Pieces team.
* A fix was implemented and released.
* The issue was resolved for affected users.

### Current Status:
* The issue is considered resolved.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Desktop App Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various performance issues with the Pieces OS desktop app, including high CPU usage, unresponsiveness, and failure to launch. These issues were linked to LTM-1 functionality, specific Linux Mint versions and accessibility settings, and stricter hardware requirements in newer app versions. Solutions involved disabling LTM-1, adjusting accessibility settings, and hotfixes/patches from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS has high CPU usage even when idle and no LLM output is processing. Closing the desktop app or any other app with integrations like VScode makes no difference. The CPU usage sometimes drops down to 0% but immediately picks up back to 90%+. 
I dont have any local LLMs or any of the browser plugins installed. I am aware that similar issue was raised last year and was supposed to be fixed in 11.1.0, maybe it wasn't fixed entirely.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bedac0a-c9aa-48b9-a86a-6a3c4698d263
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User @94tejas reported PiecesOS using too much RAM/CPU.
* Support bot suggested related issues and helpful resources.
* Support engineer @mark-at-pieces identified LTM-1 as the likely cause.
* Solutions proposed:
    * Turn off LTM-1 in settings.
    * Choose cloud-only enrichment mode.
* User confirmed turning off LTM resolved the issue.

**Outcome:**

* User successfully mitigated the issue by disabling LTM-1.
* User expressed appreciation for the prompt response and solution.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation highlights the importance of troubleshooting resources and effective communication between users and support engineers.
* It also showcases the potential of cloud processing for reducing local compute load and improving resource efficiency.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**
* Pieces app freezing on specific versions of Linux Mint.

**Problems Identified:**
* This issue is related to a known Flutter problem: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/153560.
* TextFields in the app cause the freezing when used with specific versions of Linux Mint and certain accessibility settings (e.g., on-screen keyboard).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Disable the virtual keyboard in accessibility settings.
* This issue is being tracked and a hotfix is expected soon.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The issue has been resolved for the user by disabling the virtual keyboard.
* The Pieces team will continue to monitor the situation and implement a permanent fix in the future.

**Additional Notes:**
* The user discovered the workaround independently.
* The Pieces team is responsive and helpful.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS fails to launch due to extension error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS failing to launch on Ubuntu and Windows. The error message points to a 'DatabaseException' related to the 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extension. This is likely due to hardware limitations, specifically a lack of AVX2 support. The Pieces team is aware of the issue and is working on a patch to address this, with a planned release within 24-48 hours.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Github Issue Summary: "Bootup Issue"

**Key Points:**

* Rohit0072 reported an issue with the Pieces app not booting up.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team.
* Mark, a Pieces team member, reached out to Rohit for further information.
* Tsavo, another team member, linked the issue to similar reports and mentioned an upcoming release that should fix the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app was not booting up for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark reached out to Rohit for further information.
* Tsavo linked the issue to similar reports and mentioned an upcoming release that should fix the problem.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A fix is expected to be released by the end of the day (2025-02-13).

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be related to other reported issues (#620, #624, and #625).
* Users experiencing similar issues may find the provided resources helpful.

**Word Count:** 99

recommendations: "Proactively address PiecesOS launch failures after the 11.1.1 update by communicating hardware requirements and providing troubleshooting steps for users experiencing issues."
"Investigate and optimize Pieces OS desktop app performance on Linux Mint, focusing on LTM-1 functionality and accessibility settings to reduce high CPU usage and unresponsiveness."

"Prioritize resolving the 'DatabaseException' related to the 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extension on Ubuntu and Windows to ensure all users can launch Pieces OS, potentially exploring alternative solutions for unsupported hardware."
